title: 'Spreading Hamas propaganda': Indian researcher detained in US
content: An Indian researcher at Georgetown University, Badar Khan Suri, was arrested and faces deportation under accusations of promoting Hamas propaganda. Arrests of campus activists, including Mahmoud Khalil of Columbia University, are occurring amidst heightened scrutiny by US authorities on anti-Semitic activities under the Trump administration.

title: 'Believe India is going to be lowering tariffs substantially': Trump
content: US President Donald Trump anticipates that India will likely reduce its tariffs on American goods after recognizing the imbalanced trade barriers. Trump has previously criticized India for imposing high tariffs and referred to the country as a 'tariff king' while discussing significant trade disparities.

title: Rising Indian talent to watch out for in IPL 2025
content: As the IPL 2025 season nears, standout young Indian talents such as Musheer Khan, Robin Minz, and Andre Siddarth are set to shine. They, along with other rising stars, aim to bring their batting prowess, all-rounder capabilities and impressive domestic performances to the forefront and make this edition a platform to fulfill their dream of playing for the country.

title: Netflix CEO on Apple TV+: 'I don't understand it, but they're really…'
content: Netflix co-CEO Ted Sarandos expressed his confusion regarding Apple's streaming strategy, describing it as a 'marketing play.' He also downplayed competition from Amazon Prime Video and criticized Warner Bros. Discovery's rebranding of HBO Max to Max. Sarandos highlighted Netflix's content diversity and investment in personalization as key advantages in the competitive streaming landscape.

title: Stock market today: BSE Sensex opens over 400 points up; Nifty50 crosses 23,000
content: Stock market today: BSE Sensex and Nifty50, the Indian equity benchmark indices, rose in opening trade on Thursday. While BSE Sensex rallied over 400 points, Nifty50 crossed the 23,000 mark.

title: Everything done in IPL, just the title eludes Virat Kohli
content: In 2008, Royal Challengers Bangalore signed young Virat Kohli, who has since become a cricket great. Now 36, he remains dedicated and competitive. Although RCB, which he has pledged to remain his only IPL team, has yet to win an IPL trophy, Kohli continues to play a key role.

title: Ben Stiller, Paul McCartney, 400-plus stars urge US to act against Google, OpenAI
content: Over 400 Hollywood celebrities, including Ben Stiller and Paul McCartney, oppose OpenAI and Google's attempts to relax copyright laws for AI training. They assert that such changes threaten the entertainment industry, which supports millions of jobs and significant wages annually, emphasizing the broader impact on America's cultural and knowledge sectors.

title: 'This is the last warning': Israel announces ground operations in Gaza
content: Israel has initiated fresh ground operations in Gaza, calling for the return of hostages and the removal of Hamas from power. Despite international calls for a ceasefire, airstrikes continue, causing significant casualties and displacement. Hamas remains open to discussions but firmly stands by its existing ceasefire terms.

title: Google CEO to employees : We don't make deals like this every day, so why, and why now
content: Google is making its largest acquisition ever by buying cybersecurity firm Wiz for $32 billion. CEO Sundar Pichai and Google Cloud CEO Thomas Kurian highlighted that the growing adoption of AI has made improved cloud security essential. The acquisition is expected to close by 2026, and Wiz will continue offering services through other cloud providers.

title: Solar eclipse 2025: Where to watch the first solar eclipse of the year
content: On March 29, 2025, a partial solar eclipse will be visible in parts of North America, Europe, Africa, northern Asia, Greenland, and Iceland. The northeastern United States will see it at sunrise. Western Europe and northwestern Africa will experience it in the mid- to late morning. However, it will not be visible in India.

title: Philippines calls for India to join 'squad' alliance to counter China in Indo-Pacific
content: The Philippines is urging India to join the US, Australia, and Japan in the 'Squad' alliance to counter China's territorial expansion in the South China Sea. Amid concerns over China's coercive tactics, military officials discussed bolstering maritime security in the Indo-Pacific during the Raisina Dialogue.

title: Netherlands seeks synergy with India on dual-use tech
content: The Netherlands seeks to deepen its defence collaboration with India, particularly in dual-use technologies like drones, AI, and semiconductors. Dutch Defence Minister Ruben Brekelmans expressed plans to upgrade bilateral ties to a strategic partnership, emphasizing robust security guarantees for Ukraine and reciprocal military exercises in the Indo-Pacific.

title: 'Racist intent': Connor Bedard once faced allegations of racial insensitivity
content: In 2023, Connor Bedard faced accusations of racial insensitivity after allegedly ignoring a group of Indigenous children at a Regina Pats game. This incident sparked debates about his character and the NHL's handling of diversity issues, putting Bedard under intense public scrutiny.

title: ‘The Diplomat’ Box Office Collection Day 6: John Abraham’s film inches towards Rs 20cr mark
content: The John Abraham starrer 'The Diplomat' is nearing the end of its first week at the box office with collections exceeding Rs.17 crore. Despite a promising start, the film saw significant drops during weekdays. The film, based on true events, tells the story of an Indian girl's escape from a forced marriage in Pakistan.

title: Proposed higher wage for H-1B visa holders may hinder hiring of freshers, scientists and engineers
content: Proposed wage mandates for H-1B visa holders, including a requirement to pay at least the median local wage, may hinder US companies from hiring skilled foreign workers, warns an NFAP study. These mandates could force employers to move jobs offshore, particularly affecting recent graduates in science and engineering, and could weaken the US workforce in key technology sectors.

title: Wife watching porn privately and masturbating not cruelty to husband: HC
content: Madras High Court ruled that a woman privately watching porn and masturbating does not constitute cruelty to her husband and cannot be grounds for divorce. The court emphasized that indulging in self-pleasure is not grounds for dissolution of marriage unless it adversely impacts conjugal obligations or involves the other spouse.

title: Tesla trouble: Once an icon for libs, Musk vehicles now a hated MAGA symbol
content: Tesla faces attacks in the US, including vandalism and arson on vehicles and showrooms, prompting the Trump administration to label these as acts of domestic terrorism. Despite founder Elon Musk's defense, the company sees declining sales in Europe due to backlash against Musk's behavior. Meanwhile, Chinese company BYD introduces a faster-charging system, increasing competition.

title: Tharoor's diplomacy praise for PM Modi: Wiping egg off his face or leaving Congress red-faced?
content: Congress MP Shashi Tharoor's recent praise for Prime Minister Narendra Modi has caused embarrassment within his party, prompting the BJP to mock Congress leadership. Tharoor has reiterated PM Modi's stance on the Russia-Ukraine conflict, raising concerns about his intentions and internal party dynamics ahead of the Kerala assembly elections.

title: US Federal Reserve keeps benchmark rate unchanged in 4.25-4.5% range
content: The US Federal Reserve has decided to keep the benchmark interest rate in the 4.25-4.5% range, while monitoring economic data and risks. Economic uncertainty has risen amid policy changes under President Trump.

title: 'My parents left me to die': First Indian to win UFC fight Puja Tomar
content: Puja Tomar, from Budhana village in Uttar Pradesh, became the first Indian woman to win a UFC bout. Her victory over Brazil’s Rayanne Amanda dos Santos was not just a personal triumph but a significant achievement for India. Despite a difficult upbringing, she proved that girls are not a burden and made her village proud.

title: Punjab deploys 3,000 cops to evict farmers from protest sites; top leaders held
content: Punjab Police dismantled temporary structures and detained several farmer leaders protesting at the Punjab-Haryana border over various demands. Punjab minister Harpal Singh Cheema justified the action for reopening borders, while both Congress and Akali Dal leaders criticized the government's approach. Next round of talks is set for May 4.

title: Jonathan Majors marries Meagan Good in private ceremony: Reports
content: Former Marvel actor Jonathan Majors has married actress Meagan Good in a private Los Angeles ceremony. The wedding follows Majors' proposal in Paris and coincides with his upcoming film release. Despite facing legal issues, including an assault conviction, Good supported Majors throughout, strengthening their relationship. An official wedding announcement is anticipated soon.

title: Source: Texans extend Hunter with $35.6M deal
content: DE Danielle Hunter and the Texans have agreed to a one-year, $35.6 million contract extension, a source told ESPN, confirming an NFL Network report.

title: Xavier applauds fans for big lift in rally vs. UT
content: Xavier erased a 13-point deficit in its biggest comeback win this season to beat Texas and advance to play Illinois on Friday night in a Midwest Region game at Milwaukee.

title: Mount St. Mary's rolls in First Four, to face Duke
content: Dola Adebayo and Jedy Cordilia led Mount St. Mary's to a first-round matchup versus Duke after beating American, who lost leading scorer Matt Rogers to a knee injury.

title: Lions propose significant playoff seeding change
content: The Lions have proposed a significant change to NFL playoff seeding that would largely use regular-season records as the guiding principle.

title: Sources: Wade to leave McNeese for NC State job
content: Will Wade, who has led McNeese to back-to-back Southland regular season and tourney titles, has agreed to be NC State's next basketball coach, sources told ESPN.

title: WR Moore catches on with Vikes after missing '24
content: Wide receiver/returner Rondale Moore, who missed the entire 2024 season with the Falcons because of a knee injury, has reached a deal with the Vikings.

title: Reports: Stanford coach bullied athletics staff
content: Troy Taylor remains on the job. In a statement released by Stanford, he said he had received counseling on "how I interact with others."

title: Jackie Robinson story restored at Defense Dept.
content: An article about Jackie Robinson's military service was again available on the Department of Defense website after it was initially deleted with the URL redirecting to one that added the letters "dei."

title: On Dodgers' Japan trip, Shohei Ohtani is everywhere and nowhere
content: The star is omnipresent in ads across his home country, but fan fervor keeps the real Ohtani out of sight.

title: Free agency in review: Additions, subtractions and the current state of all 32 teams
content: Following the first week of free agency, we're taking inventory on every NFL team and whom they've signed.

title: López, Dumornay, Shaw lead best U21 women's soccer players
content: Welcome to the next generation of women's stars aged 21 or under, with representatives from the NWSL, WSL and across Europe.

title: Mbappé accepts past mistakes as France captain
content: Kylian Mbappé returns to lead France against Croatia after a six-month absence and on Wednesday criticized himself over how he handled the captaincy before.

title: Source: Amorim to make call on Sancho future
content: Manchester United will let Ruben Amorim decide Jadon Sancho's future in the unlikely event that the England forward returns to Old Trafford, a source has told ESPN.

title: McKennie: U.S. needs 'nastiness' in CNL defense
content: United States midfielder Weston McKennie said it's "about time" that the U.S. brings some "nastiness" to its game ahead of Thursday's Concacaf Nations League semifinal against Panama.

title: Chelsea ink Sporting pair, deals worth up to €74M
content: Chelsea have reached an agreement to sign Sporting Lisbon's Geovany Quenda and Dario Essugo in a joint deal worth up to €74.4 million ($81.15 million), the Portuguese side confirmed on Wednesday.

title: Ex-Utd defender Jones 'embarrassed' by injuries
content: Former Manchester United defender Phil Jones has said he was "embarrassed" by the injuries that blighted his Old Trafford career.

title: Martinez joins Messi, out for World Cup qualifiers
content: Argentina striker Lautaro Martinez will miss their upcoming World Cup qualifiers against Uruguay and Brazil due to a hamstring injury, the Argentine FA said on Wednesday.

title: Gravenberch leaves Dutch squad with injury
content: Liverpool midfielder Ryan Gravenberch has been forced to withdraw from the Netherlands squad for their two-legged UEFA Nations League quarterfinal with Spain.

title: Dorvial sees 'progress' despite Brazil's struggles
content: Brazil coach Dorival Jr said his team is making progress despite sitting fifth in the standings ahead of crucial World Cup qualifiers against Colombia and Argentina.

title: NBA Power Rankings: Where all 30 teams stand with less than a month left
content: As we enter the final stretch of the 2024-25 NBA regular season, let's see where all 30 teams stack up in this week's power rankings.

title: 'It's Pop's decision. He's earned that': Inside Gregg Popovich's fight to return to the sideline
content: For the first time in 30 years, the legendary coach has been on a different sideline, battling to return to what he once was. This is the story of his season -- and what might come next for the proud franchise he leads.

title: Wetzel: Why the sky has not fallen in NCAA hoops
content: Amid changes and dire predictions about college hoops, top coaches in the game seem to have figured it out.

title: Astros pay homage to city's space history with second City Connect threads
content: Featuring "Stros" on the front of the jersey marks the organization's first official use of the fan-driven moniker.

title: Australia overreactions: McLaren unbeatable, Hamilton's Ferrari regret
content: With the first race of the 2025 F1 season now in the history books, ESPN overreacts to the biggest storylines that came to the fore in Melbourne.

title: McIlroy set up for Masters? Bhatia ready for leap? What we learned at the Players Championship
content: Rory McIlroy is off to a great start with the Masters looming, while Scottie Scheffler is catching up. Here's what we saw at the Players and what it means.

title: Scottie Scheffler stays true to roots with Masters menu
content: From cowboy ribeye to chili, the Texas native and two-time Augusta winner left his mark for the champions dinner.

title: Men's March Madness storylines: Cooper Flagg's impact and SEC dominance
content: How has the industry reacted to the bracket? There's plenty at stake in one of the year's biggest betting events.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man United ready to splurge on Simons?
content: Man United are interested in a creative attacker, and RB Leipzig's Xavi Simons fits the bill. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Farmers protest LIVE updates: Punjab Police evicts farmers from Shambhu and Khanauri protest sites
content: The protesting farmers  were camping at the Shambhu (Shambhu-Ambala) and Khanauri (Sangrur-Jind) border points between Punjab and Haryana since February 13 last year, when their march to Delhi was thwarted by security forces

title: West Bengal to allow women to work in bars, Bill passed in Assembly
content: It seeks to amend the Bengal Excise Act, 1909, “to remove the prohibition on employment of women in ON category liquor shops as such provision is discriminatory”

title: IndiaAI Mission, Gates Foundation to sign MoU on AI in agriculture, healthcare: Vaishnaw
content: IT Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw said that the Gates Foundation would tie up with the Centre’s IndiaAI Mission to develop AI solutions for agriculture, education, healthcare, and climate resilience

title: Fire at market in Maharashtra’s Chhatrapati Sambhajinagar; 20 shops damaged
content: The blaze erupted at around 5 am in the market at Central Naka in Azad Chowk area in Chhatrapati Sambhajinagar, where several furniture shops are located.

title: Behind the Scene, a one-of-its-kind app to streamline film production, launched in Malayalam cinema
content: The app, developed by Shameer Sharafudeen and Renjith Raghunathan from Thiruvananthapuram, is currently being used in several  Malayalam movies

title: Indian student at Georgetown University detained over Hamas links amid Trump’s crackdown on pro-Palestinian protests
content: The U.S. Department of Homeland Security accused Badar Khan Suri of ties to the Palestinian militant group Hamas and said he had spread Hamas propaganda and antisemitism on social media

title: Uber Shuttle’s Hyderabad rollout runs into permit trouble; 40 bus owners penalised, 11 buses seized
content: ‘Some of these buses had permits for wedding parties or sightseeing, but none had valid permissions for stage-carriage operations’

title: Bengali litterateurs protest ‘omission’ of Bengali from Sahitya Akademi Award this year
content: Writers and scholars from West Bengal have raised questions on why Bengali literary works and writers were excluded from the 2024 Sahitya Akademi Award despite Bengali being deemed a ‘classical language’ by the Government of India last year

title: Is the APAAR ID for students mandatory? | Explained
content: What does APAAR stand for? What are its touted benefits? Are State governments and school authorities pushing for its large-scale adoption? Is the collection of personal data of minors without a backing law constitutional? What are digital activists saying?

title: What are the different risks and rewards of using UAVs? | Explained
content: Why are Unmanned Aerial Vehicles seen as less of a threat compared to inhabited or piloted fighter jets? How should India evolve as UAVs become integrated into military operations?

title: Meerut murder: Wife, her lover sent to 14-day judicial custody, lawyers attack them after hearing
content: Some lawyers grabbed the man’s clothes in the melee as police tried to form a ring around the duo to protect them. Police officers had to jostle with the lawyers while they took the accused to safety

title: West Bengal DGP’s wife named State information commissioner
content: Activists question Leader of Opposition Suvendu Adhikari’s absence from meetings to appoint members to quasi judicial bodies, stating that it helps the State appoint candidates of its choice

title: BJP trying to ‘erase Shivaji’ through its pursuit of Aurangzeb: Shiv Sena (UBT)
content: The Shiv Sena (UBT) slammed the BJP for using Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj and Chhatrapati Sambhaji Raje whenever convenient

title: Central projects will strengthen port modernisation and hinterland tourism in Goa: CM
content: Goa Chief Minister Pramod Sawant attended and addressed the National Sagarmala Apex Committee Meeting, chaired by Union Minister Sarbananda Sonowal in the presence of his cabinet colleague Nitin Gadkari in New Delhi.

title: Nagpur violence: No cloth with Quranic verses burnt; rioters will be`dug out from graves', says CM Fadnavis
content: Whatever happened two days ago was a planned incident by a few people. I am not blaming any community....we did not find any 'Ayat' (Quranic verse) on the cloth that was burnt, says Maharashtra CM Devendra Fadnavis

title: India and the U.S. should expand TRUST to climate risk: Niti Aayog Vice-Chairman
content: Climate finance is crucial in supporting adaptation initiatives, says Union Minister Kirti Vardhan Singh at a conference co-organised by the Union Environment Ministry and Harvard University

title: BJP targets Hemant Soren govt. over CAG report on health
content: The party say the report indicates ‘irregularities’ in the release of funds and ‘furnishing’ of utilisation certificate;  it also accuses the government of indulging in ‘appeasement politics’

title: We never deny treatment of those coming from outside Bengal: Mamata
content: Mamata Banerjee described the health infrastructure in West Bengal as the best in the country and said people from other States have been treated in hospitals in Bengal.

title: Punjab Police detains Dallewal, Pandher in Mohali; evicts farmers from protest sites to clear roads
content: The police action is being seen in the context of the unease among industrialists in Punjab who have been pointing towards heavy losses they have incurred because of the closure of the highways

title: BJP praises Tharoor for lauding government stance on Russia-Ukraine conflict
content: Mr. Tharoor said he had opposed India’s stance when the war broke out, but the country was now in a position to make a difference for lasting peace

title: LIC’s focus on protecting the poor is changing: Rahul Gandhi
content: Changes in rules by IRDAI and LIC would make insurance less affordable to the poor and marginalised communities, says Leader of the Opposition; it will also weaken the position of agents, he adds

title: BBMP Amendment Bill proposes stricter building rules, street regulations
content: The amendments aim to tighten controls on unauthorised constructions, revise fee structures, and empower the BBMP to take over poorly maintained private streets.

title: Muslims seek permission for Sadbhavana Mela in Sambhal, after disallowing Neja Mela
content: The Neja Mela, a traditional annual fair linked to 11th century Muslim invader who allegedly took part in the loot of Somnath temple; ASP says fair is “inappropriate tradition... does not contribute to progress”

title: IMEC a ‘political project’ aimed at excluding stakeholders, Iranian official says
content: The Iranian official, speaking in a closed door briefing, cautioned that India’s collaboration with Israel could be seen as a “red line”, were Tehran to perceive such a cooperation as an “existential threat”

title: Cold-blooded murder: Priyanka Gandhi slams Israel, says its actions show humanity means nothing to them
content: Whether Western powers choose to recognise this or to acknowledge their collusion in the genocide of the Palestinian people or not, all citizens of the world who have a conscience (including many Israelis), see it, says Priyanka Gandhi Vadra

title: Government spending for healthcare increased under Modi regime: Nadda
content: The Union government is hand-holding States to develop infrastructure along with modern research and technology in the field, the Health Minister said in the Rajya Sabha

title: Railway tracks being kept vacant for a few hours every day for track maintenance, says Ashwini Vaishnaw
content: The Railway Minister told the Lok Sabha that this was the reason why some train stoppages were done away and some trains are being regulated

title: Rashtriya Gokul Mission gets ₹1,000 crore additionally
content: Union Cabinet boosts livestock sector with ₹3,400 crore Rashtriya Gokul Mission revision, focusing on high-yielding breeds and milk production growth

title: DMK MP urges Centre to prioritise north-south river-linking project
content: Congress MP dares the Modi government to name one big irrigation project it has launched in the past one decade

title: Government approves setting up of urea plant in Assam at ₹10,601.4 crore
content: The project will have a capacity of producing 12.7 Lakh Metric Tonnes of Urea annually and the new complex within the existing premises of Brahmaputra Valley Fertilizer Corporation Limited

title: Differently-abled student allotted exam hall on first floor allowed to take test on ground floor from second day
content: When a video of the woman carrying her daughter to the first floor surfaced on social media on Tuesday, HRD Minister N. Lokesh took to X to apologise to all the specially-abled students who faced such inconvenience and instructed officials to ensure the problem doesn’t repeat

title: The Hindu journalists feted at 2025 Ramnath Goenka awards
content: Maitri Porecha and Satyasundar Barik of The Hindu were felicitated for their work on the Balasore railway tragedy and human trafficking in Odisha’s border villages respectively

title: Technology an enabler, but boots on ground can’t be replaced: CDS
content: Chief of Defence Staff emphasises boots on the ground over technology; lessons learned in hybrid warfare at Raisina Dialogue

title: Child welfare council’s Kilikoottam summer camp from April 3
content: Two-month long camp, concluding on May 25, aims to make the summer holidays a fun and engaging experience for children

title: Union Cabinet revamps dairy sector scheme; allocates ₹1,000 crore for development
content: The scheme has two key components, including the measures for improving essential dairy infrastructure, such as milk chilling plants, advanced milk testing laboratories, and certification systems

title: Doubling airline capacity on India-UAE routes will help Indian consumers save $1.05 billion: report
content: The report is jointly released by ORF and the UAE embassy when there is a tug of war between Air India and Gulf carriers over international passenger traffic

title: LDF loses power in Thodupuzha municipality after UDF no-trust motion sails through
content: The no-trust motion gets the support of 18 members, including four Bharatiya Janata Party councillors, while 12 vote against it

title: 'He was a good man, hang our daughter': Parents of Meerut woman who killed husband

content: Ranya’s mother Rohini and stepfather Ramachandra Rao alleged that media houses are continuing defamatory news despite restraint orders passed by the courts

content: Resolutions accepting the lowest bids for the works were passed by the CRDA in its meeting on March 11

content: ‘Proposed amendments aimed at curtailing the powers of States with respect to waqf, besides being opposed to the secular principles enshrined in the Constitution’

content: As many as 773 exam centres have been set up across the nine educational districts of the region for the exam starting tomorrow

content: It is an attempt to conceal key facts from the Senate, the supreme authority of the university, alleges the member

content: The government said forensic analysis by the Central Forensic Science Laboratory in Chandigarh detected chlorfenapyr, an insecticide, in the viscera samples of all 17 deceased individuals

title: Minister alerts Nellore farmers to remove middlemen
content: Instead of getting deceived by the middlemen, Nadendla Manohar asks the farmers to sell their paddy for minimum support price at government-established procurement centres and receive money within 24 hours

title: 86-year-old woman kept under 'digital arrest' for 2 months, duped of Rs 20 crore
content: Mateen Hafeez, special correspondent at The Times of India in Mumbai, reports on terrorism, underworld, cybercrime and organized crime syndicates. He also writes about the jails in Maharashtra and focuses on human interest stories. He has covered the Ghatkopar bomb blast, Vile Parle bomb blast, Mulund train blast, train serial blasts in 2006, 26/11 terror attacks and Pune's German Bakery bomb blast. He has a special interest in Urdu fiction written by Ibn-e-Safi. title: MLB's spoilers: Six teams that can drop the mighty Dodgers this season
content: six of our experts pick one team they think is best suited to take down the Dodgers in October . they made their best cases for their club having the right formula to knock L.A. out . the case for the D-backs has already done this .

title: Dickie V makes his March Madness picks for every game
content: the big dance is here, and I'm ready to break it down, Dickie V style! we've got PTPers (prime time performers), diaper dandies and championship-caliber coaching ready to take the court .

title: Inside MLB's process of authenticating game-used items
content: pitcher Roki Sasaki wears an MLB debut patch on the left sleeve of his jersey . the patch will be embedded into his one-of-one numbered Topps Chrome Update Rookie Debut Patch Autograph Card . it's important for collectors to covet, chase and ultimately pull items that come off the field .

title: Google Doodle celebrates Nowruz 2025: A 3,000-year-old tradition welcoming spring
content: seasoned journalists and passionate writers tirelessly sift through the vast tapestry of global events to bring you the latest news and diverse perspectives round the clock . toi World Desk is a dedicated team of journalists and writers who work tirelessly to keep you informed about the ever-evolving world .

title: Indian In US Faces Deportation For Allegedly "Spreading Hamas Propaganda"
content: Indian student Badar Khan Suri has been accused of "spreading Hamas propaganda". He is said to have "close connections to a known or suspected terrorist".

title: Grabbing Breasts, Breaking Pyjama String Not Attempt To Rape: High Court
content: The case pertained to the accused Pawan and Akash grabbing the breasts of an 11-year-old victim, breaking her pyjama string and trying to drag her beneath a culvert.

title: US Responds To Bangladesh After Spy Chief's "Caliphate" Comment To NDTV
content: The United States has reiterated its stance on the protection of minority communities in Bangladesh, following comments by US Director of National Intelligence Tulsi Gabbard to NDTV.

title: Days After White House Showdown, Here's What Trump, Zelensky Discussed
content: Donald Trump pledged to help Kyiv get more air defense equipment from Europe, and to find Ukrainian children "abducted" by Russia.

title: Israel Announces Ground Operations, Issues "Last Warning" To Gazans
content: Israel announced renewed ground operations in Gaza on Wednesday and issued what it called a "last warning" to residents of the Palestinian territory to return hostages and remove Hamas from power.

title: For Husband's Murder, She Sent Lover Snapchat Messages Posing As Dead Mother
content: The grisly murder of a Merchant Navy officer in Meerut, whose body was chopped up and dumped in a drum, was planned by his wife, who convinced her boyfriend that his mother was speaking to him - through Snapchat - from beyond the grave.

title: "He Loved Blindly, Our Daughter Was Problem": Murdered Meerut Man's In-Laws
content: The parents of Muskaan Rastogi, arrested for allegedly murdering Merchant Navy officer Saurabh Rajput with her lover's help, want her to be hanged till death and stress that they are firmly with Saurabh's family in their fight for justice.

title: Japan Has No Public Dustbins. Blame An Attack By A Yoga Cult 30 Years Ago
content: For a first-time visitor to Japan, the lack of public dustbins is the biggest shock. Blame a subway attack by a doomsday cult on March 20, 1995

title: Merchant Navy Officer's WhatsApp Chat With Sister, Days After His Murder
content: On March 6, Merchant Navy officer Saurabh Rajput's sister Chinki got a WhatsApp message from his number, asking if she would be in Meerut for Holi. She replied yes. Another message said he was away and would only return after Holi

title: New Details Emerge In Chahal-Dhanashree Divorce Case: "Cooling Off Period..."
content: The Bombay High Court on Wednesday waived the mandatory six-month cooling off period post filing of divorce plea by cricketer Yuzvendra Chahal and his estranged wife Dhanashree Verma.

title: After Quad, India May Be Part Of New Military Grouping In South China Sea
content: Even as the Quad steadily strengthens its hold across the Indo-Pacific region, India may soon consider being a part of another key multilateral alliance that focuses on the South China Sea.

title: After 40 Years, Rape Survivor Gets Justice From Supreme Court
content: Upholding a man's conviction in a 39-year-old rape case, the Supreme Court has commiserated with the woman and her family, who had to wait so long for closure.

title: 'Mentally Tortured, Insulted...": Hardik Receives Big 'Redemption' Praise
content: It was a turbulent IPL 2024 season for Hardik Pandya after he replaced Rohit Sharma as the Mumbai Indians captain.

title: UP Woman's 2 Boyfriends, A Love Triangle And A Murder On Camera
content: She called her boyfriend to meet on the night of Holi last week. The woman promised to marry him but little did he know that his girlfriend had planned his murder with her new boyfriend.

title: "One Of The Nastiest Countries": Trump Amid Trade War With "51st State" Canada
content: Speaking to Fox News, answering why he is tougher with Canada than other big adversaries, he said, "I deal with every country, indirectly or directly. One of the nastiest countries to deal with is Canada".

title: Puffy Head, Chicken Legs: How Sunita Williams Will Readjust To Gravity
content: Crew-9 astronauts face health implications on their return after nine months in space and will undergo a 45-day rehabilitation programme.

title: Why betting the NCAA tournament is completely different from filling out your bracket
content: more people than ever are placing bets in addition to filling out their brackets . filling a bracket is like playing with pawns in chess, while sports betting is like controlling the queen . when you place a sports bet, you're betting on numbers, not teams .

title: Predicting 10 women's early-round upsets
content: the 2023 women's NCAA tournament produced four upsets . there were five in 2022, the second round gave us one last year and two the year before that . a no. 10 over a No. 7 counts just like a . no. 6 beating a. 3 in the first round .

title: USMNT wild cards who can fill vets' boots in Nations League
content: Josh Sargent reveals how his mentality has helped him find the net for Norwich . Mauricio Pochettino has sustained some body blows in the past 48 hours . the same is true for getting on the field, and the opportunity is there for some players to get unexpected .

title: White Sox's 'Celebration Cake Shake' leads new MLB park confections
content: baseball teams are becoming more innovative and stepping up their food game in 2025 . the "Celebration Cake Shake" features birthday cake ice cream, confetti cake, a pinwheel cookie and a maraschino cherry . this follows the White Sox's "Campfire Milkshake" from last season .

title: It's bracket time: Make your picks for the men's tournament
content: Welcome back to the #1 men's bracket game! The tourney tips off Thursday, 3/20 @ 12:15p ET - don't get locked out, create your brackets today! Don't forget to create a group and invite your friends to share in the madness.

title: Let the fun begin: Make your picks for the women's tournament
